summary: This document appears to be an FBI interview summary (302 form) with an unnamed individual hired for security on Little St. James Island. The interviewee describes their hiring process through Michael Turnball and their duties securing the docks, noting they never met Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Michael Turnball
persons.context: The interviewee heard about the security job on Little St. James from a friend who worked with Turnball and was told to call him to inquire about openings.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Owner of Little St. James Island
persons.context: Mentioned as the individual associated with Little St. James Island; the interviewee stated they had never met him nor seen him on the island.

connections.description: Turnball appears to be involved in hiring security personnel for Epstein's private island, Little St. James.

events.title: First day of security work on Little St. James
events.description: An unnamed individual began working security on Little St. James Island, starting at 7:00 AM, with duties including securing the docks.

events.title: Initial job inquiry call
events.description: The interviewee called Michael Turnball on either August 8 or August 9, 2019, to inquire about security job openings on Little St. James Island.

keyFacts: An unnamed individual was hired for security on Little St. James Island, Jeffrey Epstein's private island.
The hiring process involved contacting Michael Turnball, who appears to be a point of contact for security job openings on the island.
The security job entailed securing the docks and preventing tourists from coming onto the island, though they could pass through nearby waters.
The interviewee stated they had never met Jeffrey Epstein nor seen him on the island.
The document is an FBI interview summary, indicating law enforcement investigation into activities and personnel on Epstein's properties.
